result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Harmon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Harmon

records.addlTxt: Defendant's probation revoked - sentenced to county jail/hoc on 5-8-18; unpaid court obligations of $280.45 and supervision fees of $450
Filed by Atty Mark Lawton

Defendant Joshua Harmon in court, in custody with attorney Mark David Lawton. Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called: 15CF372 & 18CF57. In 15CF372 Sentencing recommendations agreed. Court sentenced the defendant on Ct. 1 to serve 90 days in jail, with Huber. Ct. 2 90 days jail, with Huber, consecutive to Ct. 1. Ct. 3 30 days jail, with Huber consecutive to Cts. 1 & 2. 108 days jail credit. Civil judgment will be entered for all unpaid financial obligations. In 18CF57 Rights/Elements. Defendant pled no contest to both counts of amended complaint. Court found guilty. Judgment was entered. Court withheld sentencing, placed the defendant on probation for 2 years. Conditions of probation include: AODA and comply with any treatment recommended. Submit DNA sample. No contact with RMV, or any under age female who is not a direct relative of defendant, does not apply at work place. Ct. 1 $443.00 costs. Ct. 2 $243.00 costs. 11:00/11:37
Judgment for Unpaid Fines, Forfeitures and Other Financial Obligations sent to 208 Faith Dr, Columbus WI 53925 returned "return to sender, not deliverable as addressed, unable to forward"
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 8, 2018 at 11:00 am.
filed by Probation Agent Michael Reisner
Defendant to be discharged from probation on 4-6-18; unpaid court obligations of $748.04
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

and Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief filed by defendant/counsel
Amended Information filed by Atty Cross

9:31 A.M., Defendant Joshua Harmon in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed, waives reading, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, Ct. 2, and Ct. 3, Judgment to be entered, Court withholds sentence, probation 2 years, Ct. 1, $443.00 costs, no contact w/Columbus Schools, defendant to provide DNA Sample, Ct. 2, $243.00 costs, no contact w/Columbus Schools, Defendant to provide DNA Sample, Ct. 3, $243.00 costs, no contact w/Columbus Schools, defendant to provide DNA Sample, on all counts case may be expunged if no further law violations and probation successfully completed after two years, Defendant to report to Probation and Parole by 11:00 today, 6 month probation review, 1 day sentence credit, 9:47 A.M.
Atty. Dolch withdraws her motion to suppress and Franks-Mann motion, requests time be set aside for motion hearing next week and used for stipulatd plea/sentencing - fax
Motion hearing on April 6, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Joshua Harmon in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.

Defendant Joshua Harmon in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  New return date requested by Atty Dolch.  Return date scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  waives reading of complaint, $2,500.00 sign bond, standard felony conditions, no contact w/Columbus Schools or their property unless for purposes of hearing or invitation by school, no use or contact w/Columbus School System computers, waives time limits to prelim,  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
